image.altText: A street sign that reads 'Wall St' in foreground of USA flag

props.synopsis: Wall Street is struck with a COVID-like blow in the wake of Donald Trump's tariffs announcement, but the US president insists his country is "healing".

title.children: US markets plummet as Trump's tariffs deliver COVID-style shock

image.altText: Dutton lowy institute

props.synopsis: Labor accuses Opposition Leader Peter Dutton of panicking over Donald Trump's trade tariffs.

title.children: Labor labels Dutton 'reckless' for seeking defence leverage to fight Trump tariffs

image.altText: Donald Trump points at something off-camera.

props.synopsis: Both sides of politics want a special deal in response to Trump's tariffs, but at what cost?

title.children: A special tariff deal with Trump could be the wrong way to go

image.altText: Catherine McApline sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: The death of a man with disability in NDIS-supported housing last month sparks a police investigation and renewed calls for mandatory provider registration.

title.children: 'Every life is valuable': Death sparks renewed NDIS registration calls

image.altText: An aerial shot of the MCG.

props.synopsis: The men were arrested and charged after allegedly bringing two guns and ammunition into the MCG during Thursday nights Carlton-Collingwood clash.

title.children: Two men charged with carrying a loaded gun into AFL match in Melbourne

image.altText: Three people at a barbecue with the words "We believe natural gas is essential..."

props.synopsis: The Coalition's internal pollster is helping orchestrate a campaign to boost public support for the gas industry ahead of the federal election in what has been described as "textbook astroturfing".

title.children: 'Textbook astroturfing': Coalition pollster working with gas campaign

image.altText: blog thumbnail 2

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton have both started in Sydney for day seven on the campaign trail. Follow live.

title.children: Albanese and Dutton both begin day seven of campaign trail in Sydney

image.altText: US President Trump holds up a board showing the reciprocal tariffs on other countries at the White House rose garden.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's new tariffs are a blow for nations that have powered their economic growth by opening large markets in the US for manufactured goods.

title.children: 'Oh look at Cambodia!': How Trump's tariffs will hit Asia

image.altText: Founder of Teach Us Consent  chanel contos speaking at the  National Press Club in Canberra on wednesday november 1

props.synopsis: There is bipartisan support for consent education to remain in the national curriculum, advocates are told.

title.children: Coalition would keep consent education in curriculum 'indoctrination' review

image.altText: Mr Macron sits at a desk with EU flags in the backdrop

props.synopsis: The German government says Donald Trump "buckles under pressure" and would water down his trade war with the European Union if he's met by a unified response from the continent.

title.children: 'Brutal' and 'unfounded': Europe vows to retaliate against Trump's tariffs

image.altText: Brown cows with white patches and ear tags run through a paddock on a hill overlooking coastline and fluffy clouds above.

props.synopsis: Australia is an exporting powerhouse, but the majority of the goods we sell overseas go to Asia.

title.children: What Australia sells overseas and who actually buys it

image.altText: Abbie Chatfield portrait photo

props.synopsis: The AEC was asked to consider whether Abbie Chatfield, Labor and the Greens needed to authorise podcast clips they posted jointly on Instagram.

title.children: AEC rules Abbie Chatfield does not need authorisation for podcast

image.altText: A man with ear-length blonde hair looks gormlessly at the camera while holding a white ice cream

props.synopsis: Mykhailo Polyakov had made two unsuccessful attempts to reach the home of the Sentinelese people before successfully reaching the restricted island.

title.children: American arrested after leaving can of Coke for uncontacted tribe

image.altText: Gout Gout and Lachlan Kennedy hit the line in the 200m at the Maurie Plant Meet.

props.synopsis: Gout Gout has stolen most of the headlines, but around him is a burgeoning generation of sprint stars some experts believe could be Australia's greatest.

title.children: Beyond Gout Gout: The other young sprint stars

image.altText: two men look at each other

props.synopsis: Hungary's government has decided to withdraw from the International Criminal Court shortly after Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu, sought under an ICC arrest warrant, arrived in the country for a state visit.

title.children: Hungary withdraws from International Criminal Court during Netanyahu visit

image.altText: A Polish soldier holding a machine gun stands by the reinforced barrier with barbed wire at the Polish-Belarusian border.

props.synopsis: As fears grow about the reliability of the United States as an ally, countries across the EU are scrambling to prepare for a possible war with Russia.

title.children: Europe is preparing for possible war with Russia, without the US

image.altText: A map of jupiter showing a wide band of hotter temperatures.

props.synopsis: Scientists say a vast region of unexpectedly high temperatures in Jupiter's upper atmosphere was caused by a massive wave of solar wind.

title.children: Source of Jupiter's mysterious 500-degree heat burst found

image.altText: Two multi-storey concrete buildings lay collapsed after an earthquake, with each level visible from the sky

props.synopsis: As the number killed in the devastating earthquake continues to rise and rescue efforts continue, forecast rain threatens to further worsen a desperate situation in Myanmar.

title.children: Rain threatens Myanmar rescue effort as earthquake death toll exceeds 3,000

image.altText: Three women cry outside as two of them embrace in an emotional hug

props.synopsis: The bodies of 15 Palestinian paramedics and emergency crews were uncovered in a mass grave last weekend, a week after Israeli forces opened fire on their convoy in southern Gaza

title.children: Israeli military denies 'execution' as it launches probe into medic killings

image.altText: A man with red hair and a red beard wearing a suit and a woman with black plaited hair and dark skin holding her chin in hand

props.synopsis: The investigation by the UK's Charity Commission comes a week after Prince Harry and other trustees resigned due to a dispute with Sentebale's chairwoman.

title.children: 'Blatant lies': Prince Harry welcomes UK watchdog probe into charity

image.altText: A blurry mother and daughter hugging in the background, a plant is in focus in the foreground.

props.synopsis: The mother of a trans teenager has successfully taken the first step in legal action against Queensland Health's director-general over the state's freeze on puberty blockers.

title.children: Mother of trans teen takes legal action over Queensland's puberty blocker freeze

image.altText: Drugs are being cut with nitazenes

props.synopsis: Health experts believe criminals are designing new nitazenes to evade detection, as the synthetic opioid is found in black market vape liquid.

title.children: New nitazine found in Australia as criminals try to evade detection

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of a man with closely cut hair in a green suit with a white collared shirt in a wood panel room.

props.synopsis: Tony Mokbel is applying for bail years before his 26-year jail sentence is up, with the Victorian Court of Appeal asked to consider his poor health and willingness to comply with strict bail conditions.

title.children: Victorian crime boss Mokbel seeking bail after 18 years behind bars

image.altText: Coconut trees surround a beach house in the Cook Islands.

props.synopsis: The Pacific nation's prime minister wants to reassess longstanding agreements with New Zealand, but Wellington is already unimpressed with the country's dealings with China.

title.children: Cook Islands want to be 'more independent'; New Zealand isn't happy

image.altText: The Starbucks logo is seen on a shop's window.

props.synopsis: Starbucks is facing two new lawsuits over spilled hot drinks, just weeks after the coffee giant was ordered to pay $79 million over a an injury caused by hot tea.

title.children: Starbucks faces new lawsuits for spilled hot drinks after $79m ruling

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Global car makers are rapidly reorganising in the wake of United States President Donald Trump's tariffs on automotive imports to the United States — and some are weighing pulling models from Australia with a climate impost about to take effect.

title.children: Car models could be pulled from sale in Australia over tariffs, emissions scheme

image.altText: Gina Rinehart Peter Dutton composite

props.synopsis: A senior Coalition source told the ABC Ms Rinehart believed the opposition leader was not sufficiently pro-business.

title.children: Peter Dutton and Gina Rinehart fall out over Coalition gas plan, net zero

image.altText: A man pictured from the side as he speaks into a mic

props.synopsis: Members of Benjamin Netanyahu's close circle are being investigated for allegedly accepting Qatari bribes to promote Doha's interests at the expense of Egypt.

title.children: Qatargate: What is the money-for-influence scandal gripping Israel?

image.altText: A discarded plastic bottle on sand in front of a grassy area and a blue horizon

props.synopsis: The new study by the CSIRO found polystyrene and cigarette butts are some of the most commonly found items in the environment.

title.children: Plastic pollution on Australian coastlines drops 39 per cent in a decade

image.altText: A ship pulls Taipan wreckage from the ocean, authorities are in a smaller watercraft nearby

props.synopsis: The Defence Flight Safety Bureau (DFSB) investigation has concluded into the army Taipan helicopter crash that killed four personnel during a training exercise off the Queensland coast in 2023.

title.children: Investigation finds pilot disorientation led to fatal army Taipan crash

image.altText: an aerial view of two police cars at Glenorie after the discovery what they believe to be human remains

props.synopsis: NSW Police has charged two people in relation to the alleged murder of 39-year-old John Birch, whose remains were discovered on a property in Glenorie last month.

title.children: Woman charged in connection to man's alleged murder in Sydney's north-west

image.altText: Big sign saying Australian National University.

props.synopsis: Independent Senator David Pocock accuses the Australian National University of misleading a Senate estimates committee over how much it paid to a consulting firm.

title.children: Pocock calls for inquiry into ANU leadership over $1 million contract

image.altText: A young man wearing a baseball cap looks down at his phone

props.synopsis: One of the four people accused of murdering Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey takes the stand for the first time to give evidence at his trial in the WA Supreme Court.

title.children: Cassius Turvey's alleged killer blames fatal trolley pole blow on co-accused

image.altText: A sea creature that is translucent orange being help by a hand towards the camera.

props.synopsis: From giant sea spiders to "sea pigs" and "sea butterflies" — analysing the rich biodiversity in Antarctica has thrilled researchers studying the impacts of climate change.

title.children: Scientists collect unique sea creatures during voyage to East Antarctica
